name: some-sass
description: Full support for @use and @forward, including aliases, prefixes and hiding. Rich documentation through SassDoc. Workspace-wide code navigation and refactoring.

somesass.css.customData.markdownDescription:
A list of relative file paths pointing to JSON files following the [custom data format](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-css-languageservice/blob/master/docs/customData.md).

Some Sass loads custom data on startup to enhance its CSS support for CSS custom properties (variables), at-rules, pseudo-classes, and pseudo-elements you specify in the JSON files.

The file paths are relative to workspace and only workspace folder settings are considered.

somesass.css.codeAction.enabled.description: Enables or disables all code actions.

somesass.css.colors.enabled.description: Enables or disables all color decorators.

somesass.css.completion.triggerPropertyV.description: By default, Some Sass triggers property value completion after selecting a CSS property. Use this setting to disable this behavior.

somesass.css.completion.completeProperty.description: Insert semicolon at end of line when completing CSS properties.

somesass.css.definition.enabled.description: Enables or disables Go to Definition.

somesass.css.diagnostics.enabled.description: Enables or disables all diagnostics (deprecation, errors and lint rules).

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.compatible.description: When using a vendor-specific prefix make sure to also include all other vendor-specific properties.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.vendorPref.description: When using a vendor-specific prefix, also include the standard property.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.duplicateP.description: Do not use duplicate style definitions.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.importStat.description: Import statements can lead to sequential loading of CSS.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.boxModel.markdownDescription: Do not use `width` or `height` when using `padding` or `border`.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.universalS.markdownDescription: The universal selector (`*`) is known to be slow.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.hexColorLe.description: Hex colors must consist of 3, 4, 6 or 8 hex numbers.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.validPrope.description: A list of properties that are not validated against the `unknownProperties` rule.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.ieHack.description: IE hacks are only necessary when supporting IE7 and older.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.propertyIg.markdownDescription: Property is ignored due to the display. E.g. with `display: inline`, the `width`, `height`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom`, and `float` properties have no effect.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.important.markdownDescription: Avoid using `!important`. It is an indication that the specificity of the entire CSS has gotten out of control and needs to be refactored.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.float.markdownDescription: Avoid using `float`. Floats lead to fragile CSS that is easy to break if one aspect of the layout changes.

somesass.css.diagnostics.lint.idSelector.description: Selectors should not contain IDs because these rules are too tightly coupled with the HTML.

somesass.css.hover.enabled.description: Enable or disable all hover information.

somesass.css.hover.documentation.description: Show property and value documentation in CSS hovers.

somesass.css.hover.references.description: Show references to MDN in CSS hovers.

somesass.css.links.enabled.description: Enable or disable the link provider that lets you click an import and open the file.

somesass.css.references.enabled.description: Enable or disable Find all references.

somesass.scss.customData.markdownDescription:
A list of relative file paths pointing to JSON files following the [custom data format](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-css-languageservice/blob/master/docs/customData.md).

somesass.scss.colors.enabled.description: Enables or disables all color decorators.

somesass.scss.completion.mixinStyle.description: Controls the style of suggestions for mixins and placeholders.
enumDescriptions: Where brackets are suggested, omit duplicates without brackets

somesass.scss.completion.suggestFromUseO.description: If your project uses the new module system with @use and @forward, you may want to only include suggestions from your used modules.

somesass.scss.diagnostics.lint.propertyI.markdownDescription: Property is ignored due to the display. E.g. with `display: inline`, the `width`, `height`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom`, and `float` properties have no effect.

somesass.scss.diagnostics.lint.important.markdownDescription: Avoid using `!important`. It is an indication that the specificity of the entire CSS has gotten out of control and needs to be refactored.

somesass.scss.diagnostics.lint.float.markdownDescription: Avoid using `float`. Floats lead to fragile CSS that is easy to break if one aspect of the layout changes.

somesass.scss.diagnostics.lint.idSelecto.description: Selectors should not contain IDs because these rules are too tightly coupled with the HTML.
